entry.title: swordtail molly (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the swordtail molly (examples pictured) and the Petén molly have been named and renamed so often, one even ending up with the other's name at one point, that the swordtail molly's current scientific name means 'confusion'?

entry.title: philosophy (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that physics, chemistry, and biology were all part of philosophy before they became separate disciplines?

entry.title: Percy Delf Smith (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that artist Percy Delf Smith's work included lettering using Roman capitals and depictions of the First World War inspired by his experiences in the trenches?

entry.title: 2006 San Miguel shooting (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the perpetrator of the 2006 San Miguel shooting greeted some former co-workers and shot at others?

entry.title: Mondelez v AMWU (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a dispute over paid sick leave at a chocolate factory ended up before the High Court of Australia in Mondelez v AMWU?

entry.title: Park Avenue Armory (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Park Avenue Armory was leased out as an art center because the New York state government could not pay for repairs?

entry.title: her 2023 season (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that during her 2023 season, Aryna Sabalenka became the first woman since Serena Williams in 2016 to reach the semifinals at all four majors in a season?

entry.title: Death Valley Girls (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Death Valley Girls have been described as "doom-boogie psych-pop"?
